description: This database contains data about each biology paper. Each PDF file is represented or parsed via different views, e.g., pages, sections, figures, tables, and references. We also extract the concrete content inside each concrete element via OCR.

table.description: This table stores metadata about each report, including the number of pages, local folder and paper id.

columns.description: A unique identifier for each paper.
The total number of pages in the biology paper.
The local folder where the PDF file is stored, and each page is stored as a separate image with the complete path {local_folder}/{paper_id}_{page_number}.png.

table.description: This table stores the concrete information for each page.

columns.description: A unique identifier for each page within a paper.
The path to the .png figure image file of the current page.
The page number on which this table is located in the paper.
The pixel width of the current page.
The pixel height of the current page.
The full text content of the current page, including all main texts, section titles, references, tables, and figures.
A foreign key linking to the paper ID in the metadata table.

table.description: This table defines the type id for each of the following content types: 1 -> main text, 2 -> section title, 3 -> reference list, 4 -> tables in the paper, 5 -> figures in the table.

columns.description: A unique identifier for each content type, only supporting 1 - 5.
The name of the content type.

table.description: This table contains concrete content information for each recognized element in each page in one biology paper.

columns.description: A unique identifier for each content element.
The type id of content, linking to the content_types table.
The text content of the current element.

The bounding box of the current element in the format [x0, y0, w, h], where (x0, y0) represents the coordinates of the top-left corner and (w, h) represents the width and height which are used to determine the shape of the rectangle.
Each content element is labeled with one distinct integer number in the current page, which starts from 0.
A foreign key linking to the paper ID in the `metadata` table.
A foreign key linking to the page ID in the `pages` table.

table.description: This table defines the parent-child relationships between different content elements, for example, some main texts belong to one section title.

columns.description: The parent content element ID.
The child content element ID.
